author: Dr Jon Nicholson
about: Jon Nicholson, PhD, is a distinguished full-stack software engineer and solutions architect with over two decades of experience. He excels in creating elegant, data-driven solutions for complex business problems and has a strong background in mathematics and algorithms.

Throughout his professional journey Jon has consistently demonstrated a knack for innovation and leadership. His blend of technical prowess and educational mentorship underscores his multifaceted approach to technology and learning.
Jon is a Member of the IEEE and a Fellow of the Higher Education Academy. He resides in Bexhill (UK) with his family.

experience.title: Experience
content: Jon is a Principal Solution Architect in the Digital Domain at Hastings Direct, managing a small team of architects who work closely with senior leadership to support and drive strategic decision-making. He has architected many high-profile deliveries, such as the digital transformation of claim notifications and post-notification handling. This has led to very positive customer engagement (increases in claims reported and managed digitally, without the need to call) and customer satisfaction (improvements in NPS). Jon has won a number of departmental awards for his contributions to the company and to his colleagues.

Previously, Jon was in the UK Education Technology sector, primarily as a Full-Stack Developer working at prominent companies performing data interchange between schools and the digital tools they use. He developed integrations with several School Management Information Service Providers to create deep data-driven integrations aligning with vendors to standardized data sets. During this time, he also represented the UK on Access4Learningâ€™s Technical Working Group.

In a past life, Jon was an academic and Senior Lecturer. He holds a PhD in formal software design (specifically the visualization and verification of class-based object-oriented software), an MSc (distinction) in distributed information management systems, and a BSc Hons (First class) in Computer Science, all from the University of Essex. To date, he has published in three high-quality journals, 10 international conferences, and contributed to a book. For five years Jon was a lecturer at the University of Brighton teaching various Computer Science subjects and was the course leader for BSc Hons Digital Games Production. He was twice nominated for Excellence in Facilitating and Enhancing Learning awards and organized prominent events like the Hastings Game Jam, for which he secured sponsorship from Studio Gobo, Oâ€™Reilly Media, and GOG.com.
